item.title: The Other, Forgotten Great Wall
item.description:
The Other, Forgotten Great Wall

In northwestern Iran, running for almost 200 kilometers from the southeastern shores of the Caspian Sea to the mountains of Bilikuh in the east, lies the remains of the Great Wall of Gorgan-once the largest defensive structure ever built.

item.title: Google's PhotoScan lets you digitize old photos in a snap
item.description:
Google's PhotoScan lets you digitize old photos in a snap

Google is making it easy to digitize and share old photos with a new app called PhotoScan - just in time to embarrass you for the holidays. PhotoScan is an app that lets you take a picture of a physical, old photo. While the user interface is simple enough for anyone to use, there’s a great deal going on in the background. The app uses machine learning to remove glares, crop out the desk or wall behind the printed photo, and make sure the colors are accurate so that you get a perfect scan.

item.title: Service Workers: an Introduction
item.description:
Service Workers: an Introduction

Rich offline experiences, periodic background syncs, push notifications--functionality that would normally require a native application--are coming to the web. Service workers provide the technical foundation that all these features rely on.

item.title: Anime master Hayao Miyazaki is coming out of retirement to make one last film
item.description:
Anime master Hayao Miyazaki is coming out of retirement to make one last film

Back in 2013, legendary Japanese animator and director Hayao Miyazaki announced he would be retiring; making no more feature-length films in order to concentrate on smaller projects. Well, it turns out you can’t keep a good Oscar-winning artist down, and Miyazaki says he’s now coming out of retirement to make one last movie.

item.title: Google threatens Qualcomm Quick Charge with Android "incompatibility"
item.description:
Google threatens Qualcomm Quick Charge with Android "incompatibility"

The proliferation of USB Type-C is making charging various devices easier than ever. Smartphones (other than the iPhone) and laptops are unifying under a single charging port, allowing any charger to plug into anything else. Today you can plug your Type-C phone into your Type-C laptop charger, and charging will happen.

item.title: Benefits of using tmux - lessons from streamlining a development environment
item.description:
Benefits of using tmux - lessons from streamlining a development environment

Before I started using tmux, I’d hear it mentioned frequently. It always sounded cool, and while there’s no shortage of great information on the web about what tmux is, it was never entirely clear to me how it would dramatically improve my development workflow. After using tmux for a few years, I’ve come to rely on its ability to streamline several aspects of my development process. Thanks to tmux, my workflow is now more organized, more automated, and easier to customize. My hope is that by sharing a few concrete examples of how tmux has helped me, it may help others better understand what might be gained by taking tmux for a spin.

item.title: Genetically Engineered Bacteria Will Be Our Martian Architects
item.description:
Genetically Engineered Bacteria Will Be Our Martian Architects

Every building starts with a strong foundation - pouring concrete into a hole, constructing on top of it. But according to Martyn Dade-Robertson, the buildings on Mars won't follow that formula, instead relying on colonies of genetically-engineered bacteria to be our de facto architects.

item.title: The Martians Are Coming-and They're Human
item.description:
The Martians Are Coming-and They're Human

In the upcoming Hollywood movie, The Space Between Us, a child is born to an American astronaut on Mars. The mother dies in childbirth, but the baby survives, and is raised by a small colony of astronauts on Mars.

item.title: History tells us what may happen next with Brexit & Trump
item.description:
History tells us what may happen next with Brexit & Trump

It seems we're entering another of those stupid seasons humans impose on themselves at fairly regular intervals. I am sketching out here opinions based on information, they may prove right, or may prove wrong, and they're intended just to challenge and be part of a wider dialogue.
